page.title: 01Barton and District
page.content: The area contains the villages of Barton-under-Needwood and Dunstall.The land is mainly flat,mixed farming and woodland and is part of the Trent Valley.Dunstall is however small and hilly and is contained in an estate run by Sir Robert Douglas.It has its own church and Cricket Club but no shops or schools.Most residents use the amenities to be found in Barton or Burton.Barton is the main residential part in the area and in the past twenty years has grown from a small quiet village to a large busy one.It has a very attractive appearance and in the 1950's and early 60's regularly won the Best Kept Village Competition in Staffordshire.The approximate number of residents is 5000 and for a village of this size has a good variety of organisations and amenities.
